sourceMeaningMnemonic: Be careful what you <radical>say</radical> in <radical>public</radical>, otherwise you might face a <kanji>lawsuit</kanji>. People will sue you for just about anything these days, so you really need to watch what you say in public, otherwise you might find yourself with a lawsuit on your hands.
meaningInfo:
Think of all the things you could say in public that could get you stuck dealing with a lawsuit.

Oh my gosh! How dare you think those things?! You're lucky you didn't say them out loud in public, or I'd file a lawsuit against you myself!
readingMnemonic: Any and all <kanji>lawsuit</kanji>s need to be brought before the <reading>Shou</reading>gun (<ja>しょう</ja>). Oh, you thought you'd get a judge or a jury? Nope, the Shougun decides your fate.
readingInfo: You better hope what you said wasn't about the Shougun, or he's really going to use this lawsuit to destroy you.
